availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. Hawes, Sr. (Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer, solider, and provisional government convention member)

body.p:
Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer, solider, and provisional government convention member.
Married to Aurelia Hawes. Father of William F. Hawes, Jr., Clara E. Hawes, Aurelia Hawes, Ann Hawes, Amelia Hawes, and Edwin Hawes. Farmer in Daviess County in 1850. Owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1850. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Hancock County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as captain.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky,Daviess County, District 1, p. 360A-B.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 949.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 83B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, Owesboro, p. 212B.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
